section TITLE
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/08-06-2019-paper-7.pdf.json

of O
half B-MATERIAL
- I-MATERIAL

compounds I-MATERIAL

( I-MATERIAL
Z I-MATERIAL
= I-MATERIAL

, I-MATERIAL

, I-MATERIAL

) O
: O
a O
density O
functional O
theory O
study O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/08-06-2019-paper-7.pdf.json
First O
principles O
investigations O
are O
performed O
to O
study O
the O
half B-MATERIAL
- I-MATERIAL
Heusler I-MATERIAL
compounds I-MATERIAL
CrScZ I-MATERIAL
( I-MATERIAL
Z I-MATERIAL
= I-MATERIAL
P I-MATERIAL
, I-MATERIAL
As I-MATERIAL
, I-MATERIAL
Sb I-MATERIAL
) O
. O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/08-06-2019-paper-7.pdf.json
In O
our O
calculations O
the O
electronic O
exchange O
correlation O
energy O
is O
determined O
by O
two O
approaches O
, O
generalized B-METHOD
gradient I-METHOD
approximation I-METHOD
( I-METHOD
GGA I-METHOD
) O
and O
generalized O
gradient O
approximation O
with O
additional O
Hubbard O
- O
U O
term O
for O
indulging O
on O
- O
site O
Coulomb O
interaction O
( O
GGA+U B-METHOD
) O
, O
independently O
. O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/08-06-2019-paper-7.pdf.json
Equilibrium O
lattice O
constants O
are O
found O
to O
be O
in O
the O
range O
of O
5 O
. O
35–6 O
. O
60 O
Å O
. O
It O
is O
revealed O
by O
the O
analysis O
of O
elastic O
properties O
that O
two O
of O
the O
compounds O
, O
CrScP O
and O
CrScAs O
, O
are O
ductile O
while O
the O
third O
compound O
, O
CrScSb O
, O
is O
brittle O
in O
nature O
in O
the O
GGA O
approach O
, O
but O
all O
the O
three O
compounds O
are O
predicted O
to O
be O
ductile O
in O
the O

id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/04-09-2019-paper-32.pdf.json
Electron O
correlation O
is O
very O
important O
for O
the O
hyperpolarizabilities O
of O
those O
species O
since O
CCSD O
( O
T O
) O
calculations O
with O
the O
aug O
- O
cc O
- O
pVDZ O
basis O
set O
predict O
that O
the O
hyperpolarizabilities O
are O
at O
least O
15 O
- O
20% O
larger O
than O
those O
predicted O
at O
the O
HF O
level O
. O

section 4
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/04-09-2019-paper-32.pdf.json
The O
analysis O
of O
the O
magnitudes O
of O
the O
hyperpolarizabilities O
reveals O
that O
they O
are O
governed O
by O
the O
type O
of O
electropositive O
atom O
. O

section 4
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/04-09-2019-paper-32.pdf.json
All O
methods O
used O
predict O
that O
the O
most O
hyperpolarizable O
clusters O
are O
the O
indium O
derivatives O
whereas O
the O
less O
( O
hyper O
) O
polarizable O
species O
are O
composed O
by O
gallium O
. O

section 4
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/04-09-2019-paper-32.pdf.json

, O
our O
results O
demonstrate O
how O
the O
bonding O
characteristics O
of O
all O
the O
investigated O
clusters O
play O
a O
vital O
role O
in O
their O
relative O
hyperpolarizabilities O
. O

section 4
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/04-09-2019-paper-32.pdf.json

, O
clusters O
that O
are O
characterized O
by O

transfer O

to O

are O

than O
species O
in O

the O

transfer O
is O

. O

section 5
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/04-09-2019-paper-32.pdf.json

analytic O
( O
hyper O
) O
polarizability O
calculations O
have O
been O
carried O
out O
with O
the O
DALTON O
suite O
of O
programs O
, O
release O
2 O
. O
0 O
( O
2004 O
) O
, O
htto O
: O
/www O
. O
kjemi O
. O
uio O
. O
no/software/Dalton/ O
. O
( O
48 O
) O

the O
various O
MP O
orders O
, O
MP2 O
yields O
the O
largest O
values O
and O
this O
is O
observed O
for O
all O
clusters O
of O
this O
study O
. O

section 5
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/04-09-2019-paper-32.pdf.json
For O
instance O
, O
the O
mean O
dipole O
hyperpolarizability O
of O
Al2P2 O
at O
MP3 O
( O
third O
order O
MP O
, O
is O
148 O
× O
103 O
au O
) O
, O
while O
at O
MP4 O
- O
DQ O
( O
doubles O
and O
quantruples O
substitutions O
) O
and O
MP4 O
- O
SDQ O
( O
singles O
doubles O
and O
quantruples O
substitutions O
) O
the O
obtained O
values O
are O
142 O
. O
8 O
× O
103 O
and O
145 O
. O
8 O
× O
103 O
au O
, O
respectively O
. O

section 5
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/04-09-2019-paper-32.pdf.json
On O
the O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/29-01-2020-part2-1702.01144v1.Band_Structure_Band_Offsets_Substitutional_Doping_and_Schottky_Barriers_in_InSe.pdf.json

of O

is O

. O

id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/28-09-2019-6a.pdf.json

the O

- O

within O
density B-METHOD

with O

investigated O

id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/28-09-2019-6a.pdf.json

to O
the O
interface O

, O
the O
magnetic O

of O
the O
interface O
atom O
gets O
enhanced O
. O

id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/28-09-2019-6a.pdf.json

on O

decreased O
. O

id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/28-09-2019-6a.pdf.json

id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/28-09-2019-6a.pdf.json

id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/28-09-2019-6a.pdf.json

id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/29-01-2020-part2-1307.7616v1.Hydrogen_accommodation_in_Zr_second_phase_particles_Implications_for_H_pick_up_and_hydriding_of_Zircaloy_2_and_Zircaloy_4.pdf.json
Ab O
- O
initio O
computer O
simulations O
have O
been O

to O
predict O
the O

associated O
with O

of O
H O
atoms O
at O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/29-01-2020-part2-1307.7616v1.Hydrogen_accommodation_in_Zr_second_phase_particles_Implications_for_H_pick_up_and_hydriding_of_Zircaloy_2_and_Zircaloy_4.pdf.json
Intermetallics O
that O
relate O
to O
the O
Zr2 O
( O
Ni O
, O
Fe O
) O
second O
phase O
particles O
( O
SPPs O
) O
found O
in O
Zircaloy O
- O
2 O
exhibit O
favourable O
solution O
enthalpies O
for O
H O
. O
The O
intermetallic O
phases O
that O
relate O
to O
the O
Zr O
( O
Cr O
, O
Fe O
) O
2 O
SPPs O
, O
found O
predominantly O
in O
Zircaloy O
- O
4 O
, O
do O
not O
offer O
favourable O
sites O
for O
interstitial O
H O
. O
It O
is O
proposed O
that O
Zr O
( O
Cr O
, O
Fe O
) O
2 O
particles O
may O
act O
as O
bridges O
for O
the O
migration O
of O
H O
through O
the O
oxide O
layer O
, O
whilst O
the O
Zr2 O
( O
Ni O
, O
Fe O
) O
- O
type O
particles O
will O
trap O
the O
migrating O
H O
until O
these O
are O
dissolved O
or O
fully O
oxidised O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/09-02-2020-1210.5353v1.Superconductivity_in_defective_pyrite_type_iridium_chalcogenides_IrxCh2_Ch_Se_and_Te.pdf.json
It O
was O
found O
that O
Ir0 O
. O
75Ch2 O
( O
Ir3Ch8 O
) O
is O
close O
to O
the O
boundary O
between O

and O

states O
and O
IrxCh2 O
systems O
undergo O
nonmetal O
to O
metal O
transitions O
as O
x O

INTRODUCTION O
In O
recent O
years O
, O
an O
interesting O
class O
of O
materials O

as O

gapless O
semiconductors O
( O

) O

attracted O
a O
lot O
of O
attention O
due O
to O
their O
peculiar O
electronic O
structure O
and O
potential O
applications O
in O
spintronic O
devices O
. O

section 0
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/28-09-2019-10a.pdf.json

materials O
exhibit O
a O
finite O
band O
gap O
for O
one O

and O
a O
closed O
gap O
for O
the O
other O
spin O
[1] O
. O

field O

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/04-09-2019-paper-23.pdf.json

theoretical O
study O
of O
structural O
, O
elastic O
, O
electronic O
and O
optical O
properties O
of O
the O
cubic O
antiperovskite B-MATERIAL
SbNMg3 I-MATERIAL
is O
presented O
using O
the O
pseudo O
- O
potential O
plane O
wave O
method O
( O
PP O
- O
PW O
) O
within O
the O
generalized O
gradient O
approximation O
( O
GGA O
) O
. O

are O
given O
for O
lattice O
constant O
, O
elastic O
constants O
and O
their O
pressure O
dependence O
. O

id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/04-09-2019-paper-23.pdf.json

section ABSTRACT
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/04-09-2019-paper-23.pdf.json

, O
the O
optical O
reflectivity O
, O

index O
, O

coefficient O
, O
dielectric O
function O
and O
electron O
energy O
loss O
are O
calculated O
for O
radiation O
up O
to O
30 O
eV O
. O

results O
are O
compared O
with O
the O
available O
theoretical O
and O

data O

section TITLE
id data_09-04-2020/fold3/dev/09-02-2020-1711.04334v1.Stable_Ultra_thin_CdTe_Crystal_A_Robust_Direct_Gap_Semiconductor.pdf.json

section ABSTRACT

RESULTS O
AND O
DISCUSSIONS O
A O
. O
Structural O
properties O
